definition: the underside of something
examples: at the bottom of the box
a cut on the bottom of her foot
The vase is signed on the bottom.

definition: a surface (such as the seat of a chair) designed to support something resting on it
examples: lost millions when the bottom dropped out of the stock market

definition: buttocks, rump
examples: a baby with a rash on his bottom

definition: the surface on which a body of water lies
examples: sank to the bottom of the ocean

definition: the part of a ship's hull lying below the water
boat, ship
examples: cargo … carried by foreign bottoms
— Virginia A. Oakes

definition: the lowest part or place
examples: the bottom of the page
stood at the bottom of the stairs

definition: the remotest or inmost point
examples: sail to the bottom of the bay

definition: the lowest or last place in rank or position
examples: The CEO started at the bottom and worked her way up.
graduated at the bottom of the class
the bottom of the pay scale

definition: the part of a garment worn on the lower part of the body, the pants of pajamas
examples: white tops and navy blue bottoms
a bikini bottom

definition: the last half of an inning
examples: the bottom of the ninth

definition: the bass or baritone instruments of a band
bottomland
examples: the Mississippi river bottoms

definition: basis, source
examples: trying to get to the bottom of these rumors

definition: capacity (as of a horse) to endure strain
examples: a breed of dogs outstanding for bottom

definition: a foundation color applied to fibers before dyeing

a fundamental quark that accounts for the existence and lifetime of upsilon particles and has an electric charge of −¹/₃ and a measured energy of approximately 5 GeV, the flavor (see flavor entry 1 sense 4b) characterizing this particle
really, basically
examples: It is, at bottom, a love song.

definition: to furnish (something, such as a chair) with a bottom
to provide a foundation for
examples: men who wanted to bottom the dreams of the Romantics
— Bonamy Dobrée

definition: to bring to the bottom
examples: bottomed the submarine on the ocean floor

definition: to find the basis or source of (something, such as a rumor) : to get to the bottom (see bottom entry 1 sense 6) of
examples: The mystery hasn't been bottomed.

definition: to become based or grounded
examples: find on what foundation any proposition bottoms
— John Locke

definition: to reach the bottom
examples: bottoming on the sea floor

definition: to reach a point where a decline is halted or reversed
examples: The team bottomed out in last place.

definition: of, relating to, or situated at the bottom (see bottom entry 1)
examples: bottom rock

definition: frequenting the lowest part or place : frequenting the bottom
examples: bottom fish
